title: MCP Stdio Proxy for Reliable Container MCP Connections

comment:
REVIEW FINDING: COMPLIANT

VERIFIED ITEMS (ALL PASS):
- Frontmatter: title = 'MCP Stdio Proxy for Reliable Container MCP Connections' (present, non-empty)
- Frontmatter: revision_summary = 'Initial draft' (appropriate for v0.1 initial creation)
- All 12 required CR sections present per SOP-002 Section 6 (Purpose, Scope, Current State, Proposed State, Change Description, Justification, Impact Assessment, Testing Summary, Implementation Plan, Execution, Execution Summary, References)
- Scope subsections complete: Context with parent ref, Changes Summary, Files Affected
- Justification complete: Problem, Impact, Root cause address all present
- Impact Assessment complete: Files, Documents, Other all present
- References include SOP-001, SOP-002, SOP-004 (meets minimum requirement)
- Parent traceability: CR-056-VAR-001 (v1.0, IN_EXECUTION) confirmed; its EI-1 ('Create and execute CR for stdio proxy implementation') directly maps to this CR
- Grandparent traceability: CR-056 referenced in Section 12
- Scope-to-EI traceability: all 4 implementation phases map to 7 EIs with no gaps
- Files Affected consistent between Section 2.3 and Section 7.1 (5 files, matching descriptions)
- No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) in pre-approved sections (1-9)
- Executable block placeholders appropriate per SOP-004 Section 5
- No typos or grammatical errors found
- Formatting consistent throughout; section numbering sequential 1-12
- Technical content sound: stdio proxy architecture directly eliminates the HTTP client failure mode

Document is compliant and ready for pre-approval routing.

POST-REVIEW FINDING: COMPLIANT

POST-REVIEW REQUIREMENTS (SOP-002 Section 7.3):

1. EXECUTION COMPLETE: All 7 EIs have Task Outcome = Pass. No Fail outcomes. No VARs required. PASS.

2. BLOCKING VARs RESOLVED: No VARs created during execution. One execution comment (SSE format discovery) was an implementation adaptation, not a scope failure. PASS.

3. DOCUMENTATION APPROVED: Section 7.2 states 'None - No controlled documents affected.' Confirmed: CR modifies only infrastructure files (Docker scripts/config), not SOPs/RS/RTM. PASS.

4. EVIDENCE DOCUMENTED: All 7 EIs contain evidence in Execution Summary:
   - EI-1: Script description (126 lines), feature list
   - EI-2: Both qms/git server configs described
   - EI-3: Specific Dockerfile additions cited
   - EI-4: Removed items (3) and kept items (4) listed; line reduction (137 to 97)
   - EI-5: Quantitative results: 30/30 scripted + 10/10 interactive = 40/40 (100%), up from 27/30 (90%)
   - EI-6: References Option A testing, both servers confirmed functional
   - EI-7: Added sections listed (proxy architecture, protocol flow, config example, rationale)
   PASS.

5. SDLC PREREQUISITES: Not applicable (Docker infrastructure, not SDLC-governed systems). PASS.

ADDITIONAL VERIFICATIONS:
- Pre-approved content (Sections 1-9): Unchanged from pre-review. PASS.
- Execution Summary (Section 11): Adequate narrative with deviation noted (SSE format). PASS.
- Implementation vs. Plan: All 4 phases executed as planned across 7 EIs. PASS.
- File artifacts verified (all 5 files confirmed on filesystem):
  * docker/scripts/mcp_proxy.py: 163 lines, stdin/stdout relay, httpx, retry, SSE parsing
  * docker/.mcp.json: Both servers use command/python3 with proxy args, no HTTP type remaining
  * docker/Dockerfile: pip install httpx + COPY proxy script confirmed
  * docker/entrypoint.sh: 97 lines, HTTP workarounds removed, essentials retained
  * docker/README.md: Stdio proxy section added, CR-057 in references
- No typos or grammatical errors in execution sections.
- Frontmatter: title and revision_summary verified.

Document is compliant and ready for post-approval routing.
